lead_paragraph: The idea was simple: to test the theory that what presidential candidates say during debates is less important than what they look like while they’re saying it.

headline.print_headline: Muting the Debate but Knowing the Score
headline.main: I Muted Donald Trump and Hillary Clinton During the Debate. I Still Knew the Score.

snippet: The idea was simple: to test the theory that what presidential candidates say during debates is less important than what they look like while they’re saying it....
abstract: Reporters Notebook; political pundits have long held theory that in analyzing presidential debates nonverbal expressions by candidates are more revealing than what is actually being said; first presidential debate between Hillary Clinton and Donald J Trump examined from perspective of theory.
